title: Unlocking Digital Gold: ATME Launches Revolutionary Gold-Backed Token
body: Imagine owning gold without the hassle of storage, security, or transportation. Bahrain-based ATME exchange has just turned this dream into reality with the launch of their gold-backed token . This groundbreaking move is injecting a fresh wave of innovation into the real world assets (RWA) market, promising to democratize access to precious metals and reshape how we perceive digital gold . Are you ready to dive into the future of finance? Why a Gold-Backed Token? The Power of Tokenized Gold For centuries, gold has been synonymous with wealth preservation and stability. However, physical gold comes with its own set of challenges: storage, security, transportation, and divisibility. Enter the gold-backed token – a revolutionary solution that merges the timeless appeal of gold with the cutting-edge efficiency of blockchain technology. ATME’s initiative directly addresses these pain points, offering a modern, streamlined approach to gold ownership. Key Advantages of Tokenized Gold: Accessibility: Tokenization lowers the barrier to entry for gold investment. You no longer need to buy large bars; you can own fractions of gold represented by tokens. Liquidity: Trading gold-backed tokens on exchanges like ATME offers significantly higher liquidity compared to physical gold markets. Buy and sell with ease, 24/7. Security: Blockchain’s inherent security features protect your digital gold holdings. Transactions are transparent and immutable, reducing the risk of fraud. Efficiency: Say goodbye to cumbersome paperwork and lengthy settlement times. Tokenized gold transactions are fast, efficient, and cost-effective. Portability: Carry your gold wealth digitally, without worrying about physical storage or transportation risks. ATME’s Gold-Backed Token: A Deep Dive into Tokenized Real World Assets ATME’s newly launched token is not just another cryptocurrency; it’s a representation of a tangible asset – 1 kilogram of physical gold for each token. This places it firmly within the realm of tokenized real world assets (RWAs), a rapidly growing segment in the crypto space. RWAs bridge the gap between traditional finance and the decentralized world of blockchain, bringing real-world value on-chain. How ATME’s Gold-Backed Token Works: 1 Token = 1 KG Gold: Each token issued by ATME is backed by 1 kilogram of physical gold, stored securely. Secondary Market Trading: Tokens can be traded on ATME’s secondary market, offering price discovery and liquidity. Redemption for Physical Gold: Token holders have the option to exchange their tokens for physical gold directly through the ATME platform. Expansion Plans: ATME isn’t stopping at gold. They plan to expand their tokenization efforts to other asset classes, further diversifying their RWA offerings. Blockchain Technology: The Backbone of Digital Gold and RWAs The magic behind digital gold and RWAs lies in blockchain technology . Blockchain provides the secure, transparent, and immutable infrastructure necessary for tokenization to thrive. It ensures the provenance and authenticity of the underlying asset, in this case, gold, and facilitates seamless transactions. Blockchain Benefits for Gold Tokenization: Transparency: All transactions are recorded on the blockchain, providing a transparent audit trail. Immutability: Once recorded, blockchain data is virtually tamper-proof, enhancing security and trust. Decentralization: Blockchain’s decentralized nature reduces reliance on intermediaries, potentially lowering costs and increasing efficiency. Smart Contracts: Blockchain enables the use of smart contracts to automate processes like redemption and ownership transfer, streamlining operations. Benefits of Investing in Gold-Backed Tokens and Digital Gold Investing in gold-backed tokens and embracing digital gold presents a compelling proposition for both seasoned investors and newcomers to the crypto space. Beyond the inherent advantages of tokenization, gold itself has historically served as a hedge against inflation and economic uncertainty. Combining these factors creates a potentially powerful investment vehicle. Investor Advantages: Diversification: Gold-backed tokens offer portfolio diversification, especially in volatile market conditions. Inflation Hedge: Gold has traditionally acted as a safe haven asset during inflationary periods, potentially preserving wealth. Accessibility to Gold: Tokenization democratizes gold investment, making it accessible to a wider range of investors. Potential for Appreciation: Like any asset, the value of gold and consequently, gold-backed tokens, can appreciate over time. Modern Investment: Embracing digital gold positions investors at the forefront of financial innovation. Navigating the Landscape of Tokenized Gold and Real World Assets While the future of tokenized gold and real world assets is bright, it’s crucial to approach this evolving landscape with informed awareness. Like any investment, there are factors to consider and potential challenges to navigate. Considerations for Investors: Regulatory Landscape: The regulatory framework for RWAs and digital assets is still developing globally. Stay informed about relevant regulations in your jurisdiction. Platform Risk: The security and reliability of the exchange or platform issuing and managing the tokens are crucial. Research and choose reputable platforms like ATME. Market Volatility: While gold is generally considered stable, the price of gold-backed tokens can still be influenced by market fluctuations and crypto market sentiment. Custodial vs. Non-Custodial: Understand whether you are holding the tokens in a custodial wallet (managed by the platform) or a non-custodial wallet (where you control your private keys). Due Diligence: Always conduct thorough research before investing in any crypto asset, including gold-backed tokens. Understand the project, the platform, and the risks involved. ATME’s launch of their gold-backed token marks a significant step forward in the tokenization of real-world assets. By leveraging blockchain technology to modernize gold ownership, they are not only solving practical challenges but also paving the way for a more accessible, efficient, and secure financial future. As the RWA market continues to expand, initiatives like this will be instrumental in bridging the gap between traditional finance and the exciting world of crypto. title: Cardano Price Set for a 50% Crash? Watch This Key Level
body: The Cardano (ADA) price is staging a much needed rebound after being slaughtered over the course of the last week, as the broader crypto market rebounds from lows. In the end, Cardano only made it into a national US crypto stockpile, which was set up by US President Trump last Thursday. And unlike the strategic Bitcoin reserve that Trump signed into law at the same time, there are currently no plans to increase the size of the stockpile via additional Cardano purchases. Worse yet for Cardano , its co-founder and figurehead head Charles Hoskinson wasn’t invited to the White House summit on crypto last week. That leaves the Cardano price vulnerable to a breakout to fresh multi-month lows under $0.55 in the coming weeks as the broader macro backdrop sours. How Low Could the Cardano Price Go? Bullish Cardano narratives have lost a great deal of traction over the last week and as the broader crypto market faces a difficult period, ADA could be destined for some underperformance. Rising concerns that the Trump administration is knowingly pursuing policies that will create short-term economic pain ( D.O.G.E austerity and trade wars) have battered risk appetite in recent weeks. That means risks are tilted to the downside for major cryptos like Cardano, which are very sensitive to the market’s broader sentiment. The Cardano price is currently testing its 200DMA for the third time in just over one month, with a convincing breakout to the downside looking increasingly likely, which could then cascade into a breakout below the February lows. That could open the door to a prolonged move lower back to the late-2024 $0.27-41 range. That would mark a drop of potentially as much as 50% from current levels. Buy the Cardano Dip? Should Cardano drop back to these depressed levels, that could offer a compelling risk-reward bet for the coming years. That’s because the current macro pain weighing on the market will almost certainly be temporary. Sure, it could last for a few months or even a year. But once macro conditions improve and the liquidity flood comes, it’s likely to be off to the races for the crypto market. That’s because the narratives behind the industry and markets are just so bullish right now – accelerating global adoption, particularly of Bitcoin, but also a now very friendly regulatory environment in the USA. However, investors would be wise not to put all their eggs in one basket, Cardano remains a highly speculative crypto owing to its lack of real world adoption and reliance on community and hype. title: Is Bitcoin’s Recovery Near? On-Chain Signals You Need to See
body: Bitcoin’s (BTC) latest dump has market participants speculating whether there will be more bloodshed in the coming weeks or if the asset’s value will record a significant recovery. Market analytics firm Santiment has identified some on-chain indicators that can offer insight into bitcoin’s movement in the short term. According to Santiment, several on-chain metrics signal that the market still has rocky times ahead, with turbulence triggered by macroeconomic and global concerns. However, BTC reaccumulation by whales and the increasing fear, uncertainty, and doubt (FUD) indicate that positive signs are beginning to emerge. “The Sky is Not Falling in Crypto” Since BTC hit an all-time high (ATH) of $109,000 the day before U.S. President Donald Trump’s inauguration in January, the cryptocurrency has been on a seven-week slump. Santiment said the fear of missing out (FOMO) did not slow down the rally, as it has often done – this was due to large BTC accumulation by whales and sharks. This accumulation continued until Trump’s inauguration in mid-January, but it began to slow down after the event and stopped in mid-February. Bitcoin’s price began to record deeper corrections when sharks and whales started taking profit. Prices have continued to plunge even after high capital BTC wallets resumed accumulation on March 3. Despite the reaccumulation, the amount of BTC moving to exchanges has been high. Santiment found that a combined 22,702 BTC (approximately 0.11% of Bitcoin’s entire supply) moved from non-exchange wallets to exchange addresses between February 20 to March 8. This is a cause for concern because the primary purpose of moving coins to exchanges is often selling. However, Santiment sees whale accumulation and exchange supply as long-term indicators, so short-term traders ought to focus more on the level of FOMO and FUD the retail crowd demonstrates daily on social media. An Incoming Bounce? Examining social media content, mentions of BTC predictions related to lower prices ($50,000 to $69,000) are currently higher than mentions for prices ranging from $100,000 to $119,000. Santiment says this is a good sign because the crypto market often moves in the opposite direction of the crowd’s expectations. The analytics firm is rooting for the social media mentions to spam lower price predictions because it shows that they are still bearish. Another metric to consider is the average rate of gains or losses from short and long term traders. Bitcoin traders active in the last 30 days have lost 11%, while those active in the past 365 days are down 5%, suggesting that the market is not in historically negative zones yet. “Don’t be surprised if there is a bit more pain in store first, though. It’s always darkest before the dawn,” the firm added. The post Is Bitcoin’s Recovery Near? On-Chain Signals You Need to See appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: What Does the SEC’s Delay of XRP, DOGE, SOL, LTC Spot ETFs Mean? Is Approval Less Likely? Bloomberg Analysts Speak Out
body: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has postponed its decision on spot exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for several altcoins, delaying the approval process of several high-profile applications. Affected applications include VanEck Spot Solana ETF, Canary Spot Litecoin ETF, Canary Spot Solana ETF, Canary Spot XRP ETF, Grayscale Spot XRP ETF, Grayscale Litecoin ETF, and Grayscale Spot Dogecoin ETF. Bloomberg ETF analysts Eric Balchunas and James Seyffart assessed the delay, saying it was expected given the SEC’s standard due diligence procedures. Seyffart noted that the delay did not necessarily reduce the likelihood of approval. He said: “Yes, the SEC has delayed a number of altcoin ETF applications, including Litecoin, Solana, XRP, and DOGE. This is expected as this is standard procedure and Atkins hasn’t even started his job yet. This doesn’t change our (relatively high) odds of approval. Also note that the final deadlines for these aren’t until October.” Related News: Will the White House Organize a New Big Cryptocurrency Summit? Senior Official Answers Balchunas also reminded in his statement that the decisions that would bring in-kind refunds to the currently traded Bitcoin and Ethereum spot ETFs were also postponed by the SEC, commenting that “everything is being postponed.” *This is not investment advice. title: Astonishing Revolution: OpenAI’s New AI Model Masters Creative Writing
body: The world of artificial intelligence is constantly evolving, and just when you think you’ve seen it all, a new breakthrough emerges that redefines what’s possible. Prepare to be amazed as OpenAI, the powerhouse behind groundbreaking AI models, announces its latest marvel: an AI specifically trained for AI creative writing that’s not just good, but according to CEO Sam Altman, ‘really good’. This announcement has sent ripples of excitement and perhaps a touch of trepidation through the creative community. Is this the dawn of a new era where machines become masterful storytellers? Let’s dive into what this could mean for the future of content creation and the broader implications for the generative AI landscape. Is This the Dawn of AI Fiction Writers? Sam Altman’s recent post on X (formerly Twitter) has ignited a firestorm of discussion. He showcased a sample of creative writing produced by this new OpenAI model , prompted with a request for a ‘metafictional literary short story about AI and grief’. Altman expressed genuine surprise and admiration, stating it was the ‘first time I have been really struck by something written by AI,’ particularly noting its grasp of metafiction. This isn’t just about AI generating text; it’s about AI understanding and executing nuanced literary concepts, suggesting a leap in AI’s creative capabilities. But what exactly makes this announcement so significant? Beyond Logic and Code: OpenAI has primarily focused on AI applications in logical and structured domains like math and programming. Venturing into AI creative writing signals a significant shift towards understanding and replicating human creativity, a domain long considered uniquely human. Wordsmithing Upgrade: This move suggests that OpenAI believes its latest generation of models represents a substantial improvement in natural language processing and generation, moving beyond basic essay writing to sophisticated storytelling. Industry Disruption?: While the release timeline remains uncertain, this development has profound implications for writers, publishers, and the entertainment industry. Could AI become a collaborator, a tool, or even a competitor in the realm of creative content? The Power of Generative AI in Storytelling Generative AI , in its essence, is about creating something new from existing data. In the context of writing, this means AI models learn from vast datasets of text and code to understand language patterns, styles, and narrative structures. The potential benefits of such advanced writing AI are vast and varied: Benefit Description Content Creation at Scale Imagine generating diverse and engaging content for marketing, education, or entertainment at unprecedented speed and volume. Personalized Storytelling AI could tailor stories to individual preferences, creating hyper-personalized reading experiences. Overcoming Writer’s Block Writers could use AI as a brainstorming partner, generating ideas, plot points, or even initial drafts to overcome creative hurdles. Accessibility and Inclusivity AI writing tools could empower individuals with writing difficulties or language barriers to express themselves creatively. Challenges and Considerations for AI Fiction While the prospect of sophisticated AI fiction is exciting, it’s crucial to acknowledge the challenges and ethical considerations that come with it: Originality and Creativity: Can AI truly be original, or is it merely remixing existing human creativity? The question of AI’s capacity for genuine creative thought remains a philosophical and practical debate. Copyright and Authorship: Who owns the copyright of AI-generated content? Establishing clear legal frameworks for AI authorship is essential. Emotional Depth and Human Experience: Can AI truly capture the nuances of human emotion, experience, and the complexities of the human condition that often form the heart of compelling stories? Job Displacement Concerns: The rise of advanced writing AI raises concerns about potential job displacement for human writers and creative professionals. Examples of AI’s Creative Spark While OpenAI’s announcement is generating buzz, it’s important to remember that AI has been making inroads into creative fields for some time. We’ve seen examples of generative AI being used for: Poetry and Songwriting: AI models can generate poems and song lyrics, sometimes with surprising artistic merit. Scriptwriting: AI is being explored for generating scripts for movies, TV shows, and even video games. Interactive Narratives: AI can power dynamic and branching storylines in games and interactive fiction, creating more immersive experiences. Actionable Insights: Preparing for the AI Creative Revolution The development of powerful AI creative writing tools is not a distant future; it’s happening now. Here’s how to prepare: Embrace AI as a Tool: Instead of fearing AI as a replacement, explore its potential as a powerful tool to augment human creativity and productivity. Develop AI Literacy: Understand how OpenAI models and other AI writing tools work, their capabilities, and limitations. Focus on Human Strengths: Hone uniquely human skills like emotional intelligence, critical thinking, and nuanced storytelling that AI may struggle to replicate fully. Engage in the Ethical Conversation: Participate in discussions about the ethical implications of AI in creative fields and help shape responsible development and usage. Conclusion: A New Chapter in Storytelling OpenAI’s announcement is a clear signal that generative AI is rapidly advancing into the realm of creative arts. While the full impact of these OpenAI models on AI fiction and content creation is yet to unfold, one thing is certain: we are on the cusp of a significant shift in how stories are created and consumed. The future of writing will likely be a collaborative dance between human ingenuity and the astonishing capabilities of artificial intelligence. It’s a time of both excitement and careful consideration as we navigate this new frontier of creative expression. title: Rep. Nick Begich Introduces Companion Legislation to Sen. Cynthia Lummis’ BITCOIN Act
body: Key Takeaways: The companion bill seeks to formalize Bitcoin as a strategic, long‑term reserve asset in the national financial framework. Lawmakers look to bolster economic independence by integrating digital assets into government holdings. The proposal mandates secure, decentralized storage and enshrines permanent, not temporary, asset management. It also emphasizes protecting individual self‑custody rights while driving innovation in fiscal policy. Congressman Nick Begich (R-AK) introduced companion legislation to Senator Cynthia Lummis’ BITCOIN Act in the U.S. House of Representatives on Tuesday, March 11, at the Bitcoin Policy Institute’s Bitcoin For America forum. Cynthia Lummis, Nick Begich Re-introduce BITCOIN Act Speaking at the March 11 event, Begich said that he would introduce same-day legislation that would see the United States develop a strategic bitcoin reserve. Today, I introduced the BITCOIN Act of 2025 in the U.S. House. The war on innovation is over and the golden age of digital currency has arrived. pic.twitter.com/5GvbP0nH4y — Congressman Nick Begich (@RepNickBegich) March 11, 2025 Representatives Addison McDowell (R-NC), Pat Harrigan (R-NC), Michael Rulli (R-OH), Troy Nehls (R-TX), Dave Taylor (R-OH), and Mike Collins (R-GA) are co-sponsoring the bill . “This legislative initiative aims to ensure the United States maintains financial independence and leadership in the global digital economy,” Begich said. “This bill recognizes bitcoin’s potential to complement our gold reserves, fortify national security, and provide economic stability in an increasingly volatile financial world,” he added. What Does The BITCOIN Act Entail? Begich’s announcement comes the same day that Lummis unveiled she would reintroduce the BITCOIN Act after her initial proposal in July 2024. If passed, the bill would establish a program to purchase 1 million Bitcoin units—representing 5% of the total Bitcoin supply—create a decentralized network of secure Bitcoin vaults for government holdings, and affirm the self-custody rights of private Bitcoin holders. Senators Marsha Blackburn (R-TN), Bernie Moreno (R-OH), Roger Marshall (R-KS), Jim Justice (R-WV), and Tommy Tuberville (R-AL) have signed on as co-sponsors for the Senate version of the legislation. “Bitcoin is not simply a technological opportunity, but a national imperative for America’s continued financial leadership in the 21st century,” Lummis said in a statement. “Together, we are not just adapting to the future—we are actively shaping it, writing the next chapter in America’s proud history of financial innovation and securing lasting prosperity for all our citizens,” she added. As lawmakers like Begich and Lummis push for the integration of Bitcoin into America’s financial framework, important questions emerge: How will such an unprecedented reserve affect global financial dynamics, and will other nations follow suit? The BITCOIN Act signals a major shift—not only in how the U.S. views digital assets but also how it approaches economic sovereignty in an era defined by technological innovation. Only time will tell if this move cements America’s position in the evolving digital economy or sets the stage for intense debate about government’s role in cryptocurrency . Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) How might a Bitcoin reserve enhance the nation’s financial posture? Integrating Bitcoin into national reserves aims to diversify government assets and provide an inflation hedge, reinforcing fiscal stability while significantly enhancing the dollar’s global standing. What risks does the proposed reserve introduce for asset management? Risks center on Bitcoin’s volatility and shifting policies that may undermine long‑term reserve strategies. Robust asset management will require strict oversight and adaptable regulations to counter market moves. How does this legislation differ from prior executive measures on digital assets? Unlike past executive orders, the bill creates a permanent legal structure for Bitcoin acquisition and storage. It enshrines long‑term holding with decentralized vaults, marking a shift from temporary measures. The post Rep. Nick Begich Introduces Companion Legislation to Sen. Cynthia Lummis’ BITCOIN Act appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: The United States Must Embrace Bitcoin Now: A Recap Of Bitcoin For America
body: Bitcoin Magazine The United States Must Embrace Bitcoin Now: A Recap Of Bitcoin For America Earlier today, the Bitcoin Policy Institute (BPI) , a Washington, D.C.-based think tank, hosted the “Bitcoin For America” summit. The event occurred in the wake of President Trump’s signing an executive order (EO) to establish a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve (SBR) and the White House’s hosting its first-ever Crypto Summit . One might have expected jingoistic overtones from an event with such a title. However, many of the speakers acknowledged that Bitcoin is something that will benefit the whole world, and that, partially because of this, the U.S. should lead the way in adoption. David Zell, Director of BPI, set the tone for the event in his opening remarks. “Our goal for today is to continue this process, to help people understand how Bitcoin benefits America — and the world writ large,” he declared. Zell was followed by Senator Cynthia Lummis (R-WY), a long-time Bitcoin advocate, who made the case that it’s only natural for America to set the pace when it comes to Bitcoin adoption. “This really is freedom money,” said Senator Lummis. “And America should lead when it comes to freedom money.” Michael Saylor: Bitcoin And American Digital Supremacy Strategy Executive Chairman Michael Saylor agreed with the Senator, making the case for why the U.S. should lead in this arena. “I’m here today to show you how the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve represents a strategy for United States digital supremacy in the 21st century,” he began. He went on to argue in favor of bitcoin as digital property, asserting that the United States should acquire as much of it as possible so that it can “rent and finance” on top of that property. He also posited that trillions of dollars in commerce will flow over the Bitcoin network, which is another reason why the U.S. should prioritize acquiring its share of the network. Moreover, he asserted that Bitcoin embodies American values and that owning it is the next best thing to living in the U.S. “Everybody who is living in Asia, in Africa would move to the U.S. if they could,” said Saylor. “They’d move their money to the U.S. if they could. They want the currency of the U.S. They want the security of the U.S. They want the values of the U.S., but they can’t have it,” he added. “So, the second best thing they can have is to move their money into the Bitcoin network, which has all of the values, protection, and security of the U.S.” Vivek Ramaswamy: Bitcoin’s Long-Term Return Is The New High-Risk Hurdle Rate Ohio gubernatorial candidate and American entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy followed Saylor, putting forward the motion that the rate of return on holding bitcoin for a decade or more is now the new high-risk hurdle rate. He set the stage for this claim by making the case that we’re moving back into an “era of scarce capital.” He shared that this will be the inverse of the past 15 years, during which the Fed printed money en masse , in a manner similar to a cocaine dealer doling out cocaine to hungry users, as he put it. He explained that institutions are going to once again have to consider the question “What is my opportunity cost of capital?” and, in doing so, they’ll have to define a hurdle rate for both low- and high-risk investments. Ramaswamy argued that the hurdle rate for low-risk investments is the 10-year U.S. Treasury, while the hurdle rate for a high-risk investment will be the rate of return on bitcoin over a 10-to-15-year period. He then closed out his talk by pointing out how the American ethos and the Bitcoin ethos overlap, and that, like the American flag, Bitcoin is a symbol of hope. “I think Bitcoin and what it represents, more than as a financial asset, also helps to fill that hunger for a symbol, a reminder of what American greatness was all about,” said Ramaswamy. “And I think it makes it, in the national context, an even more fitting asset to fill our national Strategic Reserve.” Matthew Pines: The World Is Paying Attention To Bitcoin After SBR EO Matthew Pines, Executive Director of BPI, pointed out that bitcoin is beginning to take center stage in the eyes of world leaders for two reasons. The first, he claimed, is because U.S. debt markets have become increasingly fragile, prompting global leaders to start looking to invest in a global reserve asset aside from U.S. Treasuries. The second reason is that President Trump’s SBR EO clearly stated that the United States sees bitcoin as “digital gold,” and that it will only be a matter of time before other leaders view it as the same. “Last Thursday’s executive order landed on the desk of every major president, central bank [chair] and finance minister in the world,” said Pines. “There are now discussions happening about how to interpret that. What does that mean for their own country’s relationship to bitcoin? Governments don’t move too fast, but when they do, they move in size, they move in scale and they can deploy trillions of dollars in capital that can have geopolitical effects,” he added. “And I think we’re at this inflection point where the geopolitical aspects of bitcoin start to become extremely important, and can shape the next several years of Bitcoin’s future. The Bitcoin race is now on, and the ball is in our court to maintain our advantage.” Congressman Nick Begich Reintroduces The Bitcoin Act After Pines concluded his talk, he introduced Rep. Nick Begich (R-AK) to the stage, where the Congressman made a major announcement . “Today, I will be announcing the Bitcoin Act of 2025 in the United States House,” said Rep. Begich. The bill, which is an updated version of the bill Sen. Lummis proposed last year , proposes that the U.S. acquire 1 million bitcoin (at no expense to taxpayers) and protects U.S. citizens’ right to self-custody to their bitcoin. “[The bill] explicitly protects the rights of individuals to own, hold and transact with bitcoin freely,” said Rep. Begich. “It recognizes self-custody as a fundamental right.” Congressman Ro Khanna: Democrats Should Support Bitcoin After a brief talk from Zack Shapiro, Head of Policy at BPI, on why U.S. states should hold bitcoin in their reserves, Rep. Ro Khanna (D-CA) made the case for why Democrats should embrace Bitcoin. “Bitcoin should be bipartisan,” said Rep. Khanna, the only Democratic politician to speak at the event. “Now, people are going to be able to get bitcoin. That is transformational for so many people around the world, and that is why the Democratic Party should be embracing this as something that can create financial empowerment for people not just in the United States, but around the world,” he added. Jack Mallers: Bitcoin Is A Return To American Values After a handful of talks and panels including the likes of Casa CEO Nick Neuman , Newmarket Capital CEO Andrew Hohns and Lightspark CSO Christian Catalini, Strike CEO Jack Mallers took the stage as the final speaker of the summit. In his talk, entitled “Strategic Bitcoin Reserve: The American Monetary Revolution”, Mallers made the case that the establishment of the SBR was “a return to American values — including life, liberty and property.” “The Strategic Bitcoin Reserve executive order and the Bitcoin Act proposed by Senator Lummis is the most significant economic shift and announcement and the only positive economic announcement that’s come out of this nation’s capitol in the last 100 years,” said Mallers. He went on to say that American economic policy has been working against the principles the country was founded on and cited Executive Order 6102 (gold confiscation under President Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1933), the Nixon Shock (President Nixon’s depegging the U.S. dollar from gold in 1971) and the 2008 bank bailouts as evidence. However, he ended on a high note. “[This is a] pivotal moment in American history and a turning point in economic policy for this country,” said Mallers. “The story of humanity is [people] engineering a better world — that’s America, that’s Bitcoin.” This post The United States Must Embrace Bitcoin Now: A Recap Of Bitcoin For America first appeared on Bitcoin Magazine and is written by Frank Corva .

title: Kraken Bags EMI Authorization From the UK FCA
body: Kraken, a prominent cryptocurrency exchange, has received authorization from the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) to operate as an Electronic Money Institution (EMI). This important achievement helps Kraken improve its services in the UK and strengthens its role in the fast-changing cryptocurrency market. Kraken to Offer More Financial Products According to the announcement , Kraken is now officially allowed to issue electronic money (e-money) in the UK. This approval will also help the company make it easier and faster for UK users to deposit and withdraw their funds. By issuing e-money, Kraken can manage users’ money directly, which reduces the need for third-party financial institutions and speeds up transaction times. Notably, the FCA’s endorsement allows Kraken to offer more financial products for the UK market. As more people adopt cryptocurrency worldwide, Kraken is now in a better position to launch new crypto-related financial services that meet the needs of its growing UK customer base. These services may include options like crypto-backed lending, payment processing, and It is worth noting that regulatory approval is important for protecting consumers. With the FCA monitoring Kraken’s activities, UK customers can feel safer about their funds and the rules the company follows. This will likely help build trust in Kraken’s services, especially for new users or those who are careful about using digital assets. Kraken Exchange Bows to MiCA Recall that Kraken announced plans to fully delist five stablecoins, including Tether’s USDT , across the European Economic Area (EEA). The exchange is trying to comply with the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA) to retain its relevance in the EU region. Additionally, this decision comes as part of a broader regulatory change enforced by the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). As reported, Kraken will remove support for Tether USDt (USDT), PayPal USD (PYUSD), Tether EURt (EURT), TrueUSD (TUSD), and TerraClassicUSD (UST) in Europe. However, the delisting will take place in multiple stages. The exchange also assured users that the delisting strategy is strictly for its EEA clients, spanning 30 countries, including Spain, Sweden, Austria, Portugal, and Malta. Exchanges Expands Crypto Services in the UK Like Kraken, Austrian cryptocurrency platform Bitpanda expanded its footprint in the United Kingdom in February. This expansion came after Bitpanda received regulatory approval from the FCA. With this green light, Bitpanda is set to offer UK investors access to over 500 crypto assets, marking one of the broadest selections available in the country. Furthermore, this approval is a significant milestone for Bitpanda, which had previously paused new user onboarding in the UK. The pause was due to FCA’s tightened Financial Promotions (FinProm) regime in late 2023 . Similarly, Coinbase cryptocurrency exchange secured a spot on the FCA register , permitting Coinbase to offer crypto services in the U.K. from now on, Coinbase can offer crypto and cash services to U.K. investors and traders. title: Urgent: SEC Delays VanEck’s Spot Solana ETF Approval – What’s Next?
body: Exciting times in the crypto world, or so we thought! Just when Solana enthusiasts were gearing up for a potential spot Solana ETF, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has thrown a curveball. The regulatory body announced a postponement on its decision regarding VanEck’s proposal for a spot Solana (SOL) exchange-traded fund (ETF). Let’s unpack what this significant development means for you, the crypto community, and the future of Solana ETFs. Why the SEC Postpones Decision on Solana ETF? The SEC’s move to postpone the decision isn’t entirely unexpected in the world of crypto regulation. The agency has a track record of taking its time, often citing the need for investor protection and market integrity. While the official announcement doesn’t explicitly detail the reasons for the delay, we can infer some likely factors: Market Volatility Concerns: The cryptocurrency market, including Solana, is known for its price swings. The SEC may be taking extra time to assess the potential risks associated with a spot Solana ETF, especially considering past market events. Regulatory Scrutiny: Spot crypto ETFs are still relatively new territory for the SEC. Each application undergoes rigorous examination to ensure compliance with existing securities laws and to address potential manipulation and fraud risks. Custody and Security: A crucial aspect of any crypto ETF approval is the secure custody of the underlying assets. The SEC needs to be satisfied that VanEck’s proposed custody solutions for Solana are robust and secure enough to protect investors’ holdings. Precedent Setting: Approving a spot Solana ETF would set a precedent for other altcoins. The SEC is likely considering the broader implications of such a decision and its potential impact on the wider crypto ecosystem. It’s important to remember that a postponement is not a rejection. It simply means the SEC needs more time to conduct its due diligence. Think of it as a regulatory pause button rather than a stop sign. Spot Solana ETF: What Exactly Is It? For those new to the ETF world, let’s quickly break down what a spot Solana ETF is and why it’s generating so much buzz: Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF): An ETF is an investment fund traded on stock exchanges, much like individual stocks. It holds a basket of assets, in this case, Solana. Spot ETF vs. Futures ETF: A spot ETF directly holds the underlying asset – in this case, actual SOL tokens. This is different from a futures ETF, which invests in futures contracts that predict the future price of Solana, rather than holding the asset itself. Accessibility and Convenience: A spot Solana ETF would allow traditional investors to gain exposure to Solana without directly buying and managing SOL tokens themselves. This makes investing in Solana more accessible through brokerage accounts they already use. Potential for Increased Adoption: Approval of a spot Solana ETF could significantly boost Solana’s mainstream adoption by opening the doors to institutional investors and retail investors who prefer regulated and familiar investment vehicles. Essentially, a spot Solana ETF could be a game-changer for Solana, bringing in new capital and potentially driving up demand for SOL tokens. VanEck Solana ETF: Who is VanEck and Why Does It Matter? VanEck is a well-established global investment manager with a strong track record in ETFs, including in the digital assets space. They were among the first to launch a Bitcoin futures ETF and have been vocal advocates for crypto adoption. Their proposal for a spot Solana ETF carries weight for several reasons: Aspect Significance of VanEck Reputation and Experience VanEck’s established reputation in the ETF market lends credibility to the Solana ETF proposal. Their experience navigating regulatory processes increases the likelihood of a well-structured and compliant application. First Mover Advantage If approved, VanEck’s Solana ETF would be the first of its kind in the U.S., giving them a significant first-mover advantage in capturing market share. Commitment to Crypto VanEck’s ongoing commitment to digital assets signals their belief in the long-term potential of cryptocurrencies like Solana. Their investment in developing a Solana ETF further validates Solana’s position in the market. VanEck’s involvement is a positive signal for the Solana ETF’s prospects, although SEC approval is still the ultimate hurdle. Crypto ETF Approval: A Broader Regulatory Landscape The SEC’s decision on the VanEck Solana ETF is happening within a broader context of evolving crypto regulation and ETF approvals. Here’s a look at the bigger picture: Bitcoin ETF Approval: The SEC’s landmark approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in early 2024 was a watershed moment for the crypto industry. It demonstrated a growing, albeit cautious, acceptance of crypto as an investment asset class. Ethereum ETF Race: Following the Bitcoin ETF approvals, the focus shifted to Ethereum ETFs. Several applications are currently under review, and the market is eagerly anticipating a decision. Altcoin ETFs on the Horizon?: With Bitcoin and potentially Ethereum ETFs gaining traction, the possibility of ETFs for other established cryptocurrencies like Solana is becoming a more realistic prospect. However, the SEC is likely to proceed cautiously and evaluate each case individually. Regulatory Uncertainty Remains: Despite progress, regulatory uncertainty continues to be a major factor in the crypto space. The SEC’s approach to crypto ETFs and digital asset regulation is still evolving, leading to delays and cautious decision-making. The journey towards broader crypto ETF adoption is a marathon, not a sprint. The SEC’s postponement on the Solana ETF underscores the ongoing regulatory hurdles and the need for patience. What Does the SEC Postpones Decision Mean for Solana Investors? So, what should Solana investors make of this news? Here are some key takeaways and actionable insights: Expect Continued Volatility: The delay introduces uncertainty, which could lead to continued price volatility for SOL. Be prepared for potential price swings in response to regulatory news. Long-Term Perspective is Key: Focus on the long-term fundamentals of Solana and its ecosystem. ETF approval is a potential catalyst, but Solana’s value proposition extends beyond just ETFs. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of regulatory developments and SEC announcements regarding crypto ETFs. News and updates can significantly impact market sentiment and price action. Don’t Panic Sell: A postponement is not a rejection. Avoid making impulsive decisions based on short-term news. Consider this a temporary delay in the broader adoption narrative. Diversification is Crucial: As always, diversification remains a cornerstone of sound investment strategy. Don’t put all your eggs in one basket, even if you are bullish on Solana. While the delay might be disappointing for some, it’s essential to maintain a balanced perspective and focus on the bigger picture. The crypto market is known for its resilience and innovation, and regulatory developments are part of the maturation process. Future Outlook: When Might We See a Solana ETF? Predicting the SEC’s timeline is always challenging, but we can look at historical patterns and current trends to speculate on the future outlook for a spot Solana ETF: Extended Review Period: SEC reviews can take months, sometimes even years. Expect the review period for the Solana ETF to be extended beyond the initial deadline. Further Information Requests: The SEC may issue further requests for information to VanEck, seeking more details on custody, security, market surveillance, and other aspects of the ETF proposal. Potential for Approval (Eventually): While there are no guarantees, the approval of Bitcoin ETFs suggests a potential pathway for other crypto ETFs, including Solana. The key will be addressing the SEC’s concerns and demonstrating compliance. Timeline Uncertainty: It’s difficult to pinpoint an exact timeline, but realistically, a decision on the VanEck Solana ETF might not come until late 2024 or even into 2025. Patience will be paramount for those anticipating a spot Solana ETF. The regulatory process is deliberate and thorough, and approvals are not guaranteed. However, the direction of travel in the crypto ETF space suggests that Solana ETFs, along with other altcoin ETFs, are a matter of ‘when’ rather than ‘if’. Conclusion: The Solana ETF Journey Continues The SEC’s postponement of the decision on VanEck’s spot Solana ETF is a temporary setback, not a dead end. It reflects the ongoing regulatory scrutiny and cautious approach to crypto ETFs. For Solana and the broader crypto market, this means the wait for a spot Solana ETF continues. While the delay introduces short-term uncertainty, the long-term potential of Solana and the increasing acceptance of crypto as an asset class remain powerful drivers. Investors should stay informed, maintain a long-term perspective, and prepare for continued developments in the evolving landscape of crypto regulation and ETFs. The journey to a Solana ETF may be taking longer than anticipated, but the destination remains a compelling prospect for the future of crypto investment. title: SEC Delays Decision on Canary Capital’s Spot LTC ETF: Shockwaves for Crypto Investors
body: Cryptocurrency enthusiasts and Litecoin (LTC) holders were holding their breath for a potential game-changer – a spot Litecoin Exchange Traded Fund (ETF). However, the wait just got a bit longer. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has just dropped news that has sent ripples through the crypto market: the decision on Canary Capital’s proposed spot LTC ETF has been postponed. Let’s dive into what this means, why it matters, and what could be next. What’s the Latest on the SEC and the Litecoin ETF? This postponement means the SEC requires additional scrutiny before making a final verdict on this novel financial product. Why the SEC Delay on ETF Approval? When it comes to ETF approval , particularly for spot crypto ETFs, the regulator has consistently emphasized investor protection and market integrity. Here are a few key reasons likely contributing to this delay: Market Volatility Concerns: The cryptocurrency market is known for its price swings. The SEC needs to ensure that the underlying Litecoin market is robust enough to support an ETF and prevent manipulation. Regulatory Framework Evolution: The regulatory landscape for digital assets is still developing. The SEC might be waiting for further clarity or establishing precedents before approving a spot Litecoin ETF . Custody and Security: Ensuring the secure custody of the underlying Litecoin assets within the ETF structure is paramount. The SEC will meticulously examine Canary Capital’s custody solutions. Market Surveillance: The SEC needs confidence in the surveillance mechanisms in place to detect and prevent fraud and manipulation in the Litecoin trading markets that would underpin the ETF. This accessibility is a key benefit, potentially opening up Litecoin investment to a wider audience who may be hesitant to navigate cryptocurrency exchanges directly. The Potential Impact of a Spot Litecoin ETF The approval of a spot Litecoin ETF could be a significant catalyst for the cryptocurrency. Enhanced Liquidity: ETF trading could boost liquidity in the Litecoin market, making it easier for larger trades to be executed without significant price slippage. Mainstream Adoption: An ETF can simplify Litecoin investment for retail investors, driving broader adoption and awareness of the cryptocurrency. Price Appreciation Potential: Increased demand driven by ETF inflows could exert upward pressure on Litecoin’s price. What Does This Delay Mean for Litecoin and Crypto Investors? Monitoring Regulatory Developments: Keeping an eye on SEC announcements and regulatory updates will be crucial to understanding the timeline for potential ETF approvals. Looking Ahead: The Future of Crypto ETFs The demand for spot crypto ETFs is undeniable. title: Spain’s CaixaBank, Kutxabank, Renta 4 ‘Set to Launch Crypto Services’ – Report
body: The Spanish banking giants CaixaBank, Kutxabank, and Renta 4 are set to follow BBVA into the crypto sector , and plan to start offering clients cryptoasset-related services, a report has claimed. Per El Español , many traditional banking sector firms are now eyeing the crypto market after the European Union’s MiCA regulations came into force late last year. MiCA has reportedly “opened the door for banks to start offering the custody and the sale of crypto,” the outlet wrote. CaixaBank Confirms Crypto Plans, Report Claims BBVA announced its own plans to launch Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) trading services earlier this week. However, El Español claimed that a number of other major Spanish banking players, including Bankinter, Sabadell, Unicaja, and MyInvestor said they were “not working on” launching crypto-related services. The Bankinter headquarters in Madrid, Spain. (Source: Luis García CC BY-SA 3.0 es) Santander and its subsidiary Openbank, meanwhile, “refused to comment” on their own crypto plans. BBVA will begin offering custody and sales for BTC and ETH via its mobile application later this year. The bank has completed authorization protocols with the Spanish regulator, the National Securities Market Commission (CNMV). The new regulations provided companies that already offer crypto trading with a year to complete their own registration protocols. The media outlet added that the CNMV “is now working” on the applications from three other financial services operators. While the four firms’ foray into the Spanish crypto scene represents an adoption milestone, the same newspaper noted: “We are not seeing an avalanche of applications from banks. The supervisor is only currently working to process four applications.” The media outlet said it had been able to “confirm” that one of the applications was from Renta 4. The other two, however, come from “non-banking platforms,” El Español wrote. CaixaBank and Kutxabank Have Not Yet Filed Applications Spokespeople from CaixaBank and Kutxabank told the media outlet they were still “working” on plans to offer crypto trading. But the spokespeople confirmed the two banks are yet to file their CNMV applications. CaixaBank said that it was “studying the idea” of “launching cryptoasset services in Spain this year.” The CaixaBank offices in Barcelona, Spain. (Source: Jordiferrer [CC BY-SA 3.0]) The same bank said its crypto offerings would be “especially interesting” for “young investors who are keen on technology and innovation.” Kutxabank, meanwhile, said that it hopes to offer its clients crypto custody, purchase, and sale options. It confirmed that it was “already working on” its CNMV application. By most estimations, CaixaBank is Spain’s third-largest bank. As of September 2024, its total asset holdings were worth around 520 billion euros ($568 billion). title: Meta’s AI chief says Trump and Musk are threats to America’s AI dominance
body: Yann LeCun, Meta’s chief AI scientist, submitted a letter by a coalition of AI and tech groups to the Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick, reiterating his concerns about the Trump administration’s budget-cutting strategies and how it can potentially harm the American AI industry. Yann LeCun has been vocal about his dislike for the US first buddy and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk. Last year, in a lengthy post on X, LeCun slammed Musk for his public positions on sensitive issues like politics, journalism, and the media. He also stated that Musk has no problem spreading “batshit-crazy conspiracy theories as long as they serve his interests.” My opinion of @elonmusk I like his cars (I own a 2015 S, and 2023 S), his rockets, his solar energy systems, and his satellite communication system. I also like his positions on open source and patents. But I very much disagree with him on a number of issues. I disagree with… — Yann LeCun (@ylecun) June 2, 2024 LeCun has also been pretty critical of Trump, going as far as calling the president a pathological liar. Now that Musk and Trump have strengthened their relationship and are essentially running the country together, LeCun is back to openly criticizing their methods and the potential damage their strategies could cause now and in the future. LeCun criticizes Trump’s policies on academia and AI research LeCun has accused the Trump administration of initiating a “witch hunt in academia.” His remarks follow several warnings from leaders in the AI industry that President Donald Trump’s policies could weaken America’s standing in the AI sector. On Monday, a coalition of AI and tech groups sent a letter to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, stating that the Trump administration’s decision to make cuts to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) budget could negatively impact the US in terms of AI leadership. President Trump initially supported AI research at NIST during his first term, but his current administration is scaling back funding and public-private collaboration. In the letter sent to Lutnick, the group outlined the importance of their work to the US government and stated that they are open to working with the administration to work out a strategy that benefits both parties. “NIST’s work in AI, begun under President Trump’s first term, has proven to be a critical enabler for the U.S. government and U.S. industry to maintain AI leadership globally. As the Administration considers changes to personnel and programs to better align agencies with priorities, we encourage a strategy that leverages NIST’s leadership and expertise on standards development, voluntary frameworks, public-private sector collaboration, and international harmonization,” the letter read. The group went on to acknowledge the administration’s dedication to managing federal funds effectively and how the agency contributes to the economic growth of the US. “We recognize the need to shift priorities toward a security-focused approach that maximizes economic potential and continues to foster innovation. In this context, we emphasize that NIST’s work represents a high value investment that directly contributes to U.S. economic growth, competitiveness, and technological leadership. We caution that downsizing NIST or eliminating these initiatives will have ramifications for the ability of the American AI industry to continue to lead globally.” LeCun drew parallels between Trump’s decision to cut the NIST budget and the Cold War-era Red Scare. At that time, Qian Xuesen, a Chinese scientist was deported from the US in the 1950s and later worked to advance China’s nuclear missile program. Dan A. Kimball, the then-United States Undersecretary of the Navy, remarked that deporting Qian Xuesen was “the stupidest thing this country ever did.” In relation to this situation, LeCun is saying that Trump is making a stupid decision by stifling AI research. The effect of the Trump administration on research The Trump administration is blowing its way through federal agencies and employees, serially issuing executive orders to reduce funding and lay off employees. It announced drastic cuts to the National Institutes of Health, not acknowledging that the move would effectively and abruptly cut off billions in federal funding for biomedical research. These cuts in funding have sparked significant concern among the US-based scientific community. Elon Musk’s DOGE , created for the purpose of cost cutting, has also been deployed to federal agencies, including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency, and NASA. Trump also signed an executive order against the DEIA mandate. The Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility (DEIA) Talent Sourcing for America initiative was launched in September 2022 to position the federal government as a model of inclusion and equity. With Trump putting an end to it, many are concerned that it could threaten scientific research at universities. “The US seems set on destroying its public research funding system. title: Reassuring Prediction: IBM CEO Dismisses AI Replacing Programmers Soon
body: In a world buzzing with discussions about artificial intelligence taking over various professions, a sigh of relief comes from an unexpected corner – the top office of tech giant IBM. CEO Arvind Krishna has weighed in on the burning question: Will AI replace programmers? His answer? Not anytime soon. Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, recently predicted that a staggering 90% of code could be AI-generated within a mere three to six months. However, IBM’s Arvind Krishna offers a more grounded perspective. He estimates that AI might handle around 20-30% of coding tasks, a far cry from a complete takeover. Krishna emphasizes that while AI excels at simple coding tasks, complex scenarios still demand human ingenuity and problem-solving skills. This is particularly relevant in the crypto world, where intricate smart contracts and decentralized applications require nuanced coding expertise. IBM CEO AI Insights on Global Talent and Growth Krishna’s SXSW interview wasn’t solely focused on AI. He also touched upon global trade and talent, issues that indirectly impact the tech landscape, including the cryptocurrency sector. He highlighted the importance of global collaboration for economic growth, stating, “every 10% increase in global trade leads to a 1% increase in local GDP.” This interconnectedness extends to talent acquisition. Krishna advocated for policies that encourage international talent flow into the U.S., arguing that it fosters innovation and mutual learning. In the crypto space, which is inherently global and decentralized, this perspective resonates deeply. Openness to international talent is vital for the continued growth and diversification of blockchain technology. AI Augmentation, Not Replacement: The Future of Programmers Instead of viewing AI as a job-stealing menace, Krishna positions it as a powerful tool to enhance programmer productivity. He argues that AI will augment human capabilities, allowing programmers to achieve more in less time. Think of it like this: Increased Efficiency: AI can automate repetitive coding tasks, freeing up programmers to focus on higher-level design and problem-solving. This delay introduces a layer of uncertainty into the highly anticipated crypto ETF space, particularly for Solana enthusiasts and the broader digital asset investment community. Let’s delve into what this SEC ETF delay means and what could be the potential ramifications. What Does the SEC’s Solana ETF Delay Signify? The SEC’s decision to postpone the verdict on Canary Capital’s Solana ETF application isn’t entirely unexpected, but it’s undoubtedly a significant development. For those unfamiliar, an ETF, or Exchange Traded Fund, is a type of investment fund that trades on stock exchanges, much like stocks. A spot crypto ETF approval , specifically for Solana, would allow investors to gain exposure to SOL without directly holding the cryptocurrency. This is a game-changer because: Accessibility: ETFs are easily accessible through traditional brokerage accounts, making crypto investments available to a wider range of investors who may be hesitant to navigate crypto exchanges directly. Regulation and Security: ETFs operate within a regulated framework, offering a sense of security and compliance that some investors find reassuring compared to the often-unregulated crypto space. Liquidity: ETFs are highly liquid, meaning they can be bought and sold easily during market hours, providing flexibility to investors. However, the SEC’s postponement injects a dose of reality into the optimistic narrative surrounding crypto ETFs, especially those beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum. It raises questions about the regulatory body’s comfort level with altcoins like Solana and the broader implications for future crypto ETF approval processes. Why Canary Capital’s Solana ETF is a Big Deal? Canary Capital ETF proposing a spot Solana ETF is a noteworthy event for several reasons: First Mover Advantage (Potentially): If approved, this would be the first spot Solana ETF in the U.S. market, giving Canary Capital a significant first-mover advantage. This could attract substantial investment as Solana gains more mainstream acceptance. Validation for Solana: A successful Canary Capital ETF would be a massive validation for Solana as an asset class. It signals institutional interest and growing confidence in SOL’s long-term prospects beyond just retail investment. Diversification in Crypto ETFs: Currently, the ETF market is heavily focused on Bitcoin and, increasingly, Ethereum. A Solana ETF would diversify the crypto ETF landscape, offering investors more choices and opportunities to invest in different blockchain ecosystems. The proposal itself underscores the increasing maturity of the cryptocurrency market and the desire from traditional financial players to offer regulated investment products centered around digital assets beyond the giants like Bitcoin. What’s Behind the SEC’s Hesitation on Solana ETF? While the SEC has approved Bitcoin spot ETFs and is seemingly moving towards Ethereum ETFs, the delay in the Solana ETF decision suggests ongoing scrutiny. What could be the potential reasons for this hesitation? Regulatory Uncertainty around Altcoins: The SEC’s stance on cryptocurrencies beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum remains somewhat ambiguous. There are ongoing debates about whether certain cryptocurrencies should be classified as securities. Solana, while a major player, falls into this category of altcoins that face greater regulatory uncertainty compared to Bitcoin and Ethereum, which are often considered commodities. Market Volatility and Maturity of Solana: While Solana has established itself as a prominent blockchain, it’s still relatively newer and potentially more volatile than Bitcoin or Ethereum. The SEC might be taking a more cautious approach to ensure the market’s maturity and resilience before approving ETFs based on assets like SOL. Market Manipulation Concerns: Regulators are always concerned about market manipulation. The SEC needs to be convinced that the Solana market is sufficiently robust and surveilled to prevent manipulation in an ETF product. This requires assessing the liquidity and oversight mechanisms in place for Solana trading. Custody and Security: Ensuring the secure custody of underlying Solana assets for an ETF is crucial. The SEC needs to be satisfied with the custody solutions proposed by Canary Capital and the overall security framework for holding SOL at an institutional scale. It’s important to remember that the SEC’s role is to protect investors and maintain market integrity. Their due diligence process, while frustrating for those eager for a Solana ETF, is a necessary step to ensure responsible innovation in the financial markets. Market Sentiment Shift: The delay could dampen overall market sentiment towards Solana and potentially other altcoins seeking ETF approvals. title: Crucial Stablecoin Debate: US House Committee Begins Regulatory Talks
body: The world of cryptocurrency is buzzing with anticipation as the U.S. House Financial Services Committee has officially commenced discussions on stablecoins . This marks a potentially pivotal moment for the digital asset landscape, signaling a deeper dive into regulatory frameworks that could shape the future of these increasingly popular digital currencies. For crypto enthusiasts and industry stakeholders alike, this development is something to watch closely. Why are Stablecoins Under the Spotlight? Stablecoins have emerged as a significant component of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Unlike their more volatile counterparts like Bitcoin or Ethereum, stablecoins are designed to maintain a stable value, typically pegged to a fiat currency like the US dollar. This stability makes them attractive for various use cases, including: Facilitating Trading: Stablecoins provide a less volatile asset for traders to move in and out of positions within the crypto market, acting as a safe haven during market fluctuations. Enabling Payments: Their price stability makes stablecoins suitable for everyday transactions and cross-border payments, offering a digital alternative to traditional currencies. DeFi Ecosystem: Stablecoins are the backbone of many Decentralized Finance (DeFi) applications, used for lending, borrowing, and yield farming due to their predictable value. However, the rapid growth and increasing adoption of stablecoins have also raised concerns among regulators globally. These concerns primarily revolve around: Systemic Risk: The potential for large-scale stablecoin adoption to impact the broader financial system if not properly regulated. Consumer Protection: Ensuring users are protected from potential risks associated with stablecoin issuers, including transparency and reserve management. Money Laundering and Illicit Activities: Addressing concerns about the use of stablecoins for illegal activities due to the pseudo-anonymous nature of cryptocurrency transactions. Inside the House Financial Services Committee Discussions on Crypto Regulations According to a report by Blockworks, the U.S. House Financial Services Committee is not starting from scratch. Lawmakers are reportedly considering several bills, indicating a proactive approach to crafting crypto regulations . Key discussion points appear to include: Rep. Tom Emmer’s CBDC Issuance Restriction Law: This proposed law aims to limit the issuance of a central bank digital currency (CBDC). The implications of a CBDC are far-reaching, and this bill suggests a cautious approach from some lawmakers, potentially favoring private sector innovation in the digital currency space. CFPB Regulations Targeting Tech Companies: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is reportedly looking at regulations targeting technology companies involved in payment apps and digital wallets. This could directly impact how stablecoins are integrated into existing payment infrastructures and consumer-facing applications. These discussions signal a multi-faceted approach to crypto regulations , encompassing both the potential of CBDCs and the existing landscape of private stablecoins and digital payment systems. The committee’s deliberations are crucial as they will likely set the stage for future legislation and regulatory clarity within the U.S. crypto market. Trump’s Stance: Stablecoin Legislation Before August Recess? Adding another layer of intrigue, former U.S. President Donald Trump has reportedly expressed a desire to see stablecoin legislation passed before the August recess. Speaking at the White House Crypto Summit, Trump’s comments highlight the urgency and political attention that stablecoin regulation is now receiving at the highest levels of government. This timeline, while ambitious, underscores the momentum behind establishing a clear regulatory framework for stablecoins. The push for swift action could be driven by various factors, including: Geopolitical Competition: The U.S. may be keen to establish itself as a leader in blockchain technology and digital asset regulation, particularly as other nations advance their own digital currency initiatives. Economic Stability: Policymakers might be aiming to mitigate potential risks associated with unregulated stablecoin growth to safeguard financial stability. Innovation and Growth: A clear regulatory framework could foster innovation and growth within the blockchain technology and cryptocurrency sectors by providing businesses with the necessary legal certainty to operate and invest. What Could These Discussions Mean for the Future of Stablecoins? The ongoing discussions by the House Financial Services Committee are not just procedural; they represent a critical juncture for the future of stablecoins and the broader crypto ecosystem. Here’s a breakdown of potential implications: Potential Outcome Impact on Stablecoins Clear Regulatory Framework Could foster wider adoption by institutional investors and mainstream users due to increased trust and legitimacy. May also lead to standardization and interoperability. Strict Regulations Could stifle innovation if overly burdensome, potentially pushing stablecoin activity to other jurisdictions with more lenient rules. May increase compliance costs for issuers. CBDC Development Could compete with private stablecoins, potentially reshaping the market. The extent of competition will depend on the design and accessibility of the CBDC. Consumer Protection Focus Likely to lead to enhanced transparency requirements for stablecoin issuers, potentially requiring regular audits and disclosures of reserves. Actionable Insights: Staying Ahead of the Curve For those involved in the cryptocurrency space, whether as investors, developers, or businesses, staying informed about these regulatory developments is paramount. Here are some actionable insights: Monitor Regulatory News: Keep a close watch on updates from the House Financial Services Committee and other regulatory bodies like the SEC and CFTC. Engage in Industry Discussions: Participate in industry forums and discussions to understand the potential impacts of upcoming regulations and contribute to shaping responsible regulatory frameworks. Assess Compliance Readiness: If you are involved in issuing or using stablecoins, begin assessing your compliance readiness for potential new regulations. This includes reviewing reserve management practices, KYC/AML procedures, and transparency measures. Diversify and Adapt: Be prepared to adapt your strategies based on the evolving regulatory landscape. Diversification across different types of cryptocurrencies and DeFi protocols can help mitigate risks associated with regulatory changes. Conclusion: A Pivotal Moment for Digital Currency The U.S. House Financial Services Committee’s commencement of discussions on stablecoins is undeniably a crucial moment for the cryptocurrency industry. These deliberations will likely pave the way for significant regulatory changes that could define the trajectory of stablecoins and the broader digital currency ecosystem in the United States and potentially globally. As lawmakers grapple with balancing innovation, consumer protection, and financial stability, the crypto world watches with bated breath, anticipating the outcomes that will shape the future of finance. title: Barstool founder and Jailstool investor Dave Portnoy offered role in Trump Commerce Department
body: Dave Portnoy, owner of Barstool Sports and longtime supporter of President Trump, recently took to X, formerly Twitter, to reveal that he was approached with a job in the Trump administration. His post included a tweet and a video of himself explaining how he would have had to give up running his sports, gambling, and pop-culture media company to fill such a role. Dave Portnoy wants to know Elon Musk’s secret formula Portnoy, who goes by @stoolpresidente on X, shared the post on Tuesday with claims that he had received a call that potentially offered him the opportunity to join the Commerce Department working under Secretary Howard Lutnick. Portnoy conveniently omitted details regarding the nature of the job. However, he said he was told that if he agreed to become a government employee, he would have to relinquish his role as leader of Barstool. It made him question how a person like Elon Musk, who serves as CEO of not one one, not two but a number of companies including Tesla and SpaceX, is able to juggle all his responsibilities while maintaining appearances as the leader of Trump’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Elon Musk poses beside President Trump after delivering his new Tesla. Source: The White House (X/Twitter) “How do you run Tesla when you’re working on DOGE 24-7?” Portnoy wanted to know in the video. “You kind of want your CEO with the eye on the ball, right?” Portnoy also stated that the White House never followed up after the initial outreach. That part did not surprise some of his followers on X. In fact, one user went as far as saying that they most probably had a rethink — most likely after realizing Portnoy has too much baggage to be in any position of government. It is not completely far-fetched for Portnoy to have gotten such an offer, after all, he has been a vocal supporter of Trump since 2020 when he interviewed him at the White House at the tail end of Trump’s first term. In fact, as far back as 2015, Portnoy was already planning to vote for Trump. “I don’t care if he’s a joke. I don’t care if he’s racist. I don’t care if he’s sexist. I don’t care about any of it. I hope he stays in the race and I hope he wins. Why? Because I love the fact that he is making other politicians squirm,” he wrote in a blog post at the time. Dave Portnoy has become a high-profile memecoin investor Dave Portnoy has courted controversy recently with his foray into the world of memecoin trading. Some of the memes he has been involved with include $Jailstool, a meme tied to his Barstool persona, which he personally endorsed and invested in; then $Trump and $Libra, which he promoted and also invested in. Portnoy sees memecoin trading as a game of risk. He attracted criticism for leveraging his fame to manipulate market movements and advertise memes to his less crypto-savvy audience, transforming them into exit liquidity at the push of a button. His involvement has led to accusations of rugs and market manipulation, with accusers claiming Portnoy typically sells his holdings after tweeting about a token. So far, he has had massive wins and incredible losses in the space and while his approach to trading is seen as chaotic, it has been a source of entertainment to his audience whom he often carries along via live. Dave Portnoy poses for a selfie on a street. Source: Dave Portnoy (X/Twitter) Dave Portnoy is most popular for being the founder of Barstool Sports, which he established as a print publication. In 2023, Dave Portnoy became the owner of Barstool again after buying it back from casino and online gambling operator Penn Entertainment for $1. The sale came months after Penn Entertainment paid about $550 million to acquire 100% control of Barstool before deciding to drop the company due to regulatory hurdles. It was only after buying back the company that he realized an important fact — “we underestimated just how tough it is for myself and Barstool to operate in a regulated world.” Portnoy claimed they were denied [gambling] licenses because of his affiliation with the company and even conceded that the regulated industry [is] probably not the best place for Barstool Sports or its content. Reasons why his affiliation would cause so much harm to his company can most likely be traced to the many past allegations of racism, sexism and sexual misconduct Portnoy has been linked to over the past several years. Portnoy has publicly denied all the allegations, claiming that the encounters were consensual. That was years ago. More recent scandals involving Portnoy have not had anything to do with his Barstool business. Business owners who received offers of employment from Trump’s government Portnoy’s desire to know how Musk can juggle his roles as CEO and handle his responsibilities at DOGE is valid. When the government reaches out to a person with a post and they accept the position, they usually have to step back from their previous engagements to be able to serve fully. Musk did not have to leave his roles because he is a special government employee, not a Cabinet member. Aside from Elon Musk, four other cabinet members of Trump also have extensive roots in the business world. Howard Lutnick, who, was nominated as Secretary of Commerce is the CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald, a major financial services firm; Linda McMahon who, was nominated as Secretary of Education, is the former CEO of WWE and a prominent business figure; Scott Bessent, the Secretary of the Treasury is a hedge fund manager and CEO of Key Square Group, a major investment firm while Doug Burgum the Secretary of the Interior is a former CEO of Great Plains Software which was sold to Microsoft for $1.1 billion. Lutnick has had to disclose his financial holdings and step back as CEO of Cantor after rivals highlighted how his ties to the company, which is famous for its relationship with the Chinese, could pose a conflict of interest. title: Solana Falls Under Realized Price: Here’s What Happened Last Time
body: On-chain data shows Solana (SOL) has seen its spot value drop under the Realized Price for the first time in three years following the recent bearish action. Solana Has Just Seen A Breakdown Of The Realized Price According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode, Solana has slipped around 8% below its Realized Price. The “Realized Price” is an indicator that basically tells us about the cost basis of the average investor or address on a given network. Related Reading: Dogecoin To $2 Could Be Next If DOGE Holds This Level: Analyst When the spot price of the asset is trading above this metric, it means the holders as a whole are carrying a net unrealized profit. On the other hand, it being under the indicator suggests the average investor is underwater. Now, here is the chart shared by the analytics firm that shows the trend in the Realized Price for Solana over the last few years: As is visible in the above graph, SOL broke above its Realized Price back in 2023, putting investors into the green. Throughout 2024 and the first couple of months of this year, the price remained above the line, but recently, it seems another crossover has finally occurred. “Solana just plunged below its Realized Price for the first time in nearly 3 years,” notes Glassnode. At the current exchange rate, the price is around 8% below this metric, which means the average holder of the asset could be assumed to be 8% in the red. From the chart, it’s apparent that the last time the cryptocurrency saw this type of crossover was back in 2022. Losing the level then meant the start of a bear market. Thus, it’s possible that the latest breakdown of the line could prove to be a bad sign for the coin this time as well. Historically, the Realized Price has played the role of a boundary between bear and bull trends for not just SOL, but also other digital assets. In another X post, Glassnode has shared the data for a version of the indicator for Bitcoin, the number one cryptocurrency. The metric displayed in the chart is the Realized Price of the short-term holders, which only measures the average cost basis of the investors who purchased their coins within the past 155 days. Unlike the Realized Price of the entire network, this version of the indicator serves more like a boundary line for short-term momentum shifts.
